snippet.title: Salmonella decline seen in food poisoning report
snippet.description: The government's latest report card on food poisoning shows a dip in salmonella cases but an increase in illnesses from bacteria in raw shellfish. The report counts cases in only 10 states for some of the most common causes of foodborne illness, but is believed to be a good indicator of national food poisoning trends. Highlights from Thursday's report from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention:

snippet.title: Teen urinates in Oregon reservoir. Millions of gallons of drinking water wasted.
snippet.description: Teen urinates in Oregon reservoir. Millions of gallons of drinking water wasted.

snippet.title: Foster Farms salmonella outbreak continuing
snippet.description: A salmonella outbreak linked to Foster Farms chicken isn't over and has now infected 524 people in 25 states and Puerto Rico, federal health officials said.

snippet.title: Rough seas prolonged rescue of family, sick baby
snippet.description: Eric and Charlotte Kaufman had already struggled for days, pounded by waves, aboard their disabled sailboat by the time skydiving National Guardsmen answered their distress call from hundreds of miles off the Mexican coast, and their vomiting, feverish, 1-year-old daughter could not have withstood much more.

snippet.title: Sailing family back in US with ailing baby
snippet.description: Six days after a family of four found themselves helpless and adrift in a sailboat far into the Pacific with a vomiting, feverish 1-year-old, a Navy warship delivered them safely Wednesday to San Diego, where they began their attempted around-the world voyage before the child was born.

snippet.title: AP News in Brief at 5:58 a.m. EDT
snippet.description: More underwater pings heard in hunt for missing jet, raising hopes wreckage will soon be found

snippet.title: Is organic better for your health? A look at milk, meat, eggs, produce and fish.
snippet.description: A look nutrition and contamination of organic vs conventional meat, milk, produce, eggs and fish

snippet.title: Mystery of pet deaths related to jerky treats made in China continues to stump FDA
snippet.description: More than seven years after problems surfaced, FDA still searching for answers.

snippet.title: People who are cruel to animals pose a danger to society as a whole
snippet.description: Animal cruelty is bad for everyone; dealing with dogs' amorous behavior; another view on trap, neuter, release.

snippet.title: Congress members protest USDA's proposed poultry inspection system
snippet.description: Sixty-eight members of Congress ask Department of Agriculture Secretary Tom Vilsack to withdraw a proposal that would substantially change how chickens and turkeys are inspected.
